geninfo.para: Navistar recently became aware of several instances where a portable welder was used to jump-start several vehicles. Due to excessive voltage being applied to the vehicles, engine control modules were destroyed, resulting in repair costs of over $2000.00 per vehicle
Navistar vehicles are currently equipped with various electronic components including, but not limited to:
Excessive voltage or current applied to electronic components may damage or destroy them, resulting in expensive repairs.

caution.para: To avoid damage to vehicle electronic components, voltage supplied to a vehicle's electronic system must never exceed 16.0 volts. This voltage must not be exceeded when the ignition switch is in the "off" "acc" or "ign" position, or during engine cranking. The most reliable means for jump-starting a vehicle is to use batteries connected so as to provide 12 volts.

geninfo.para: Electric welders must never be used for vehicle jump starting as such devices are commonly current controlled, not voltage controlled.
Electronic component failures caused by excessive voltage or current will be denied warranty reimbursement.
Further important information on jump-starting procedures and precautions are contained in Service Manual section CTS-5021 - Maintenance Free Batteries.
